identificationModule.briefTitle: Stem Cell Transplant From Donors After Alpha Beta Cell Depletion in Children and Young Adults
identificationModule.officialTitle: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation From an HLA-partially Matched Related or Unrelated Donor After TCR αβ+T Cells/CD19+ B Cell Depletion in Children and Young Adults Affected by Malignant or Non-Malignant Hematological Disorders

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the CliniMACS® TCRαβ-Biotin System and CliniMACS® CD19 is to improve the safety and efficacy of allogeneic HLA-partially matched related or unrelated donors HSCT when no matched donors are available, to treat malignant and nonmalignant disorders for which HSCT is the recommended best available therapy. Initially this device will be used in a single-center, open-label, single-arm, phase II clinical trial to evaluate the efficacy of haploidentical PBSC grafts depleted of TCRα/β+ and CD19+ cells using the CliniMACS® TCRαβ/CD19 System in children and adults with hematological and non-hematological malignancies.

armGroups.label: Stem Cell Transplant -Malignant
armGroups.description: The participant with a malignancy will undergo a stem cell transplant using donor cells that have been manipulated through an investigational device. Participants will be followed for outcomes for two years.
interventionNames: Device: CliniMACS TCR α/β Reagent Kit and CliniMACS CD19

armGroups.label: Stem Cell Transplant - Non-Malignant
armGroups.description: The participant with a non-malignant disease will undergo a stem cell transplant using donor cells that have been manipulated through an investigational device. Participants will be followed for outcomes for two years.
interventionNames: Device: CliniMACS TCR α/β Reagent Kit and CliniMACS CD19

interventions.name: Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant
interventions.description: The allogeneic stem cell transplant involves transferring the stem cells from a healthy person (donor) to the participant via infusion.

interventions.name: CliniMACS TCR α/β Reagent Kit and CliniMACS CD19
interventions.description: The CliniMACS™system can be used to selectively enrich or reduce specific cell populations based on the magnetic cell selection (MACS) technology developed by Miltenyi Biotec. Cell mixtures can be separated in a magnetic field using one or more immunomagnetic- labeled antibodies specific for the cell types of interest (e.g.TCR αβ+ T cells and CD19+ B cells from HPC(A) products).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with grade II-IV acute GvHD at day 100 after HSCT

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with chronic GVHD at 1 year after HSCT
Leukemia-free survival at 1 year after HSCT
secondaryOutcomes.description: Leukemia-free survival defined as the time of enrollment to disease relapse or death from any cause.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Leukemia-free survival at 2 years after HSCT
secondaryOutcomes.description: Leukemia-free survival defined as the time of enrollment to disease relapse or death from any cause.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with secondary graft failure at 1 year after HSCT
Number of participants with secondary graft failure at 2 years after HSCT
Number of participants with grade III-IV acute GvHD at day 100 after HSCT
Number of participants with successful engraftment at day 42 after HSCT

overallOfficials.name: Alice Bertaina, MD, PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Associate Professor of Pediatrics, Stem Cell Transplantation
